properties.areaDesc: Cortland; Northern Wayne; Tioga; Broome; Southern Wayne; Susquehanna; Wyoming; Lackawanna; Tompkins; Southern Cayuga; Seneca; Luzerne; Onondaga; Chenango
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 3:10PM EST until January 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and some mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of a light
glaze. Southeast winds gusting as high as 35 mph will create
areas of blowing and drifting snow.

* WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Susquehanna, Northern Wayne, Wyoming,
Lackawanna, Luzerne and Southern Wayne counties. In New York,
Seneca, Southern Cayuga, Onondaga, Tompkins, Cortland,
Chenango, Tioga and Broome counties.

* WHEN...Steady snow quickly develops late Saturday morning and
continues through the afternoon hours. Some sleet could mix in
during the late afternoon. The snow tapers off to snow showers,
light sleet and patchy freezing drizzle Saturday evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could briefly be around 1
inch per hour midday or early afternoon Saturday. Temperatures
will be in the upper teens to twenties on Saturday, rising into
the lower 30s by evening.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways,
and traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM EST SATURDAY
